data.title: Able to add a custom cursor.
data.body:
Hello,
I tried to use a spriteBatch as a cursor but it has a short delay. In OpenTK there is an option to set a custom cursor. Maybe it could be possible to implement this directly in MonoGame for both WindowsGL and WindowsDX.

data.title: Fixed bug in detection of "natural" orientation of Android device.
data.body:
My setup: landscape game running on a 480*854 device having portrait "natural" orientation.
Device is lying on a flat surface, I launch the game. `OrientationListener.GetDeviceDefaultOrientation()` is called from `Activity.OnCreate()`, it returns `Landscape` "natural" orientation, which is wrong.
I grab device in my hand and rotate it. The screen flips when phone orientation is portrait or reverse portrait.

This pull request contains fixes:
- Value of "natural" orientation is computed on first `OnOrientationChanged()` call (not in ctor, because it may return invalid value if called too early).
- Orientation listener is active between `Activity.OnResume()`/`OnPause()` calls.
- Orientation value of `OrientationUnknown` (-1) is ignored.

data.title: MonoGame WinForms create device error
Granular control over  precision qualifier
data.body:
At the moment the MonoGame Effect Processor applies the required precision qualifier (mediump, highp) for all uniforms of a type in the entire shader.

MGFX could use the type of each variable / uniform in order to infer the precision qualifier in a more granular way.
HLSL seems to offer a way to request minimum precision with a special set of scalar type (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb509646(v=vs.85).aspx) and I was wondering if anybody already looked into this and/or what would be the best place to add support for such a feature.

data.title: Intermediate Deserializer Unit Tests
data.body: This adds unit tests for the intermediate deserializer.  Currently they only run successfully under MS XNA.  My next step is to use these tests to get the rest of the MonoGame implementation working correctly.

data.title: Access & ContentSerializerCollectionItemNameAttribute
data.body:
- Fixed some types that were public and shouldn't be.
- Added missing ContentSerializerCollectionItemNameAttribute.

data.title: Fix for #2460. Windows Phone 8 compilation on VS2013.2.
data.body: You just can't compile WP8 version when using VS2013.2. https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/865927/compiling-monogame-for-windowsphone-fails . A simple full name reference fixes the problem. This is a temporary fix, but with no down side. This probably won't break any other version.

data.title: Update Protobuild
data.body: This updates Protobuild to the latest version that includes support for services and dependencies.  It does not actually modify the MonoGame project to offer services or modify WindowsGL at all, so everything should behave as it currently does.

data.title: Render faster if possible on fixed time step
data.body:
Currently when MonoGame is using a fixed time step, it won't ever render faster than 60FPS, despite the GPUs capability to do so.

This modifies the tick so that if SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace is off, it will continue to render frames until the time is used up (instead of sleeping).

This is useful for diagnosing whether rendering is responsible for causing slow frames by giving an accurate representation of how fast the current frame can be rendered.

data.title: Fixed iOS NumericOverFlow Exceptions
data.body:
for Color components and Constantbuffer PlatformInitialize

I have been getting numericoverflow exceptions in iOS after updating to Xamarin.iOS 3.0.54.0 in Visual Studio with latest version of Xcode, VS2013 update 2. 

This is a simple bit mask/shift fix to ensure that the values are never larger than Byte which solves the issue. There may be other places that require this but I have only found these so far.

data.title: ListReader doesn't return correct type when using a type with a ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute
data.body:
When a ListReader (And I assume DictionaryReader as well, but I've only noticed it happen with lists) writes out a type that has a ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute attached to it, the GetRuntimeType() string will contain the type containing the attribute, rather than the type the attribute defines.

Below is an example of one of the incorrectly returned GetRuntimeType() strings.

Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ListReader`1[[MyNamespace.MyClassUsingTheAttributeContent, MyAssembly, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]

data.title: CppSharp Update
data.body: Just updated dependencies to latest CppSharp.

data.title: Divided accelerometer values on Android by gravity to match XNA and iOS.
data.body:
XNA and iOS report accelerometer values in gravitational units, default value is (0; 1; 0).
Android reports values in SI units (m/s^2), default value is (0; 9.81; 0).
This PR makes [Android](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/hardware/SensorEvent.html#values) accelerometer values match [XNA](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsphone/develop/microsoft.devices.sensors.accelerometerreadingeventargs.aspx) and [iOS](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/coremotion/reference/CMAccelerometerData_Class/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/doc/c_ref/CMAcceleration).
Android apps that were using old values will be broken.

data.title: Add support for SamplerState.MaxMipLevel (WindowsGL and iOS)
data.body:
SamplerState.MaxMipLevel allows to limit the maximum mipmap (the smallest one) used when mipmap filtering is enabled.
This adds support for it on WindowsGL (native support) and iOS (i am not sure there are any equivalent extension from other vendors).

This has been tested in production for a while in our branch; i am slowly bringing back all the changes we made since our last fork.

data.title: Mouse cursor doesn't hide in WindowsGL while middle or right mouse button is pressed
data.body: Mouse cursor is displayed in WindowsGL project when right or middle mouse button pressed even if IsMouseVisible is set to false.

data.title: MouseState.Button out of date
data.body:
MonoGame stops processing mouse events when the game is not active, leading to the mouse buttons being 'out of date' when the game window becomes active again. 

Fix is to reset to current actual state on window activate.

data.title: Pipeline Tool Item Rebuilds
data.body:
This adds the feature where you can right click on individual items in the Pipeline GUI tool and force a rebuild of just that item.

This also has a refactor of how context menus are setup to be more like WinForm apps.

data.title: MGCB Source DateTime
data.body: We now store the source file `DateTime` and ensure we rebuild the content if it changes from the last build.  This fixes the case where the source file is reverted or replaced with another that is older than the output XNB.

data.title: Implement Missing Render States In 2MGFX
data.body:
We are missing support for a bunch of the render states in the 2MGFX compiler.  This includes:
- StencilEnable
- StencilFail
- StencilFunc
- StencilMask
- StencilPass
- StencilRef
- StencilWriteMask
- StencilZFail
- TextureFactor
- ZFunc

We need to extend the MGFX parser to support them and hook them up to the existing render state initialization.

See the Effect States docs for details:

 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb173347(v=vs.85).aspx

data.title: Add support for StencilWriteMask to OpenGL backend
Update Threading
data.body: From Cocos2DXNA to fix WP behaviour

data.title: Texture2D.FromStream on iOS and Mac
data.body: Allow loading textures directly from system images (UIImage, NSImage) on iOS and Mac, avoiding having to turn the image to stream and then read it from stream. This is very useful for loading album art from the MediaLib.

data.title: Make content extensions public again
data.body:
Make content extensions public again as it has very useful reflection methods. We use them in our other projects.

@tomspilman turned this into internal around a month ago in this commit https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/562ff8d654c903bf97f64962b954b4b8fad91ec7, but while the others are MonoGame specific, these are very general reflection methods, unrelated to MonoGame.

data.title: Detect deadlock in Threading
data.body:
Threading.cs offers a nice way to execute things on the main thread, but for example WP8 has severe deadlock problems. It would be nice to follow Unity's footsteps (new in 4.5):

> AppCallbacks methods InvokeOnUIThread and InvokeOnAppThread will detect deadlock and throw exception. Added TryInvokeOnUIThread and TryInvokeOnAppThread, which return true or false instead.

data.title: Removed TextureContent._bitmap.
data.body:
The importer still uses System.Drawing.Bitmap internally for loading / format conversion.
Font processing still uses bitmaps internally.
TextureProcessor will use a bitmap for 'resize power of two' operations.

However, they no longer assume there is a bitmap ready and identical to the actual TextureContent.Face[0][0], which was a source of errors. If they need a bitmap to do some isolated operation, they make one, then get rid of it.

data.title: Added Missing ContentSerializer Attributes
data.body:
This adds the missing `ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute` and `ContentSerializerTypeVersionAttribute`.

We also fixed a bug in `ReflectiveWriter`.

Thanks @RayBatts for pointing out these issues.

data.title: Fixed exception: No constructor found for MonoGameAndroidGameView
data.body:
I got exception once when suspending Android app. It's caused by virtual member call `View.SetOnTouchListener` from `MonoGameAndroidGameView` constructor. Fixed. Explained here: [MonoDroid: Error when calling constructor...](http://stackoverflow.com/a/10603714/742047)
I also removed unnecessary `OrientationListener._activity` member to fix potential leak of activity.


data.title: Implement ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute
data.body: ContentSerializerRuntimeTypeAttribute isn't yet implemented in MonoGame. We just need to create the attribute and make sure the reflective and generic writers get the correct runtime type string from any content item that has this attribute.

data.title: MonoGame_3.0.0.mpack for Xamarin Studio not installing
data.body: I tried to install monogame addin, "MonoGame_3.0.0.mpack for Xamarin Studio" to Xamarin Studio 5, on a mac but it could not be installed because of dependencies conflicts of "Core v4.0" and "Ide v4.0". please help
